data.title: Use resolved file name (through dictionary lookup) in font atlas creation
data.body:
If using the dictionary lookup mechanism of FileUtils, and multiple TTF files are replaced by the same one, FontAtlasCache was creating as many duplicate copies of the replacing font as there were of replaced fonts.

When using big TTF font, that can lead to a significant increase in memory used.

I've added 2 tests to FontTests. The first one is the reference test without any replacements, the second one have every font used being replaced by arial.

Without the change to FontAtlasCache, the second test takes more memory than the first one (since multiple atlases are created for arial, which is a bigger TTF file than the other), whereas with the change, the second test takes less memory (since only one atlas is created for arial).

data.title: fixed #16787: Removes unused code of 'if (sizeof(Vec2) == sizeof(Vec2)'.
data.body: fixed https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16787

data.title: Fix small .mtl files not being loaded
data.body:
In the case of a simple MTL file such as 

> newmtl cube
>   Ns 10.0000
>   Ni 1.5000
>   d 1.0000
>   Tr 0.0000
>   Tf 1.0000 1.0000 1.0000 
>   illum 2
>   Ka 0.0000 0.0000 0.0000
>   Kd 0.5880 0.5880 0.5880
>   Ks 0.0000 0.0000 0.0000
>   Ke 0.0000 0.0000 0.0000
>   map_Ka cube.png
>   map_Kd cube.png

The entire istringstream would be consumed by LoadMTL and result in a 'not found' error due to the null check being in the wrong place

data.title: Add new methods to get the number of actions running in a given node with a specific tag.
data.body:
This is useful for cases that we want to know how many
animations with a **specific** tag is running in our target.
For example:

auto tag1Count = this->getNumberOfRunningActionsByTag(kMyTag1);
auto tag2Count = this->getNumberOfRunningActionsByTag(kMyTag2);

While this could be achieved (more or less) with callbacks
to increment the tagCount at start of action and decrement
at the end the proposed API is much more concise and less error
prone.

data.title: synthesize the accessor of window property
data.body:
`AppController` class that implements `UIApplicationDelegate` protocol must have accessor methods for `window` property. If not, the following code will raises the exception.

```objc
UIWindow* window = [UIApplication sharedApplication].delegate.window;
```

data.title: Difference in Spine default blend function behavior between native and webGL.
data.body:
There is a difference in the logic that handles blend functions for spine skeletons between native and WebGL.

We can see in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/editor-support/spine/SkeletonRenderer.cpp#L238 that we have 3 options, ADDITIVE, MULTIPLY, and SCREEN. If none of these are chosen, we will either get GL_ONE/GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, or GL_SRC_ALPHA/GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA depending on if we have premultiplied alpha. However, if we  examine https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-html5/blob/e10208255f9eae2c25db5e04e395f4258406dbcd/extensions/spine/CCSkeletonWebGLRenderCmd.js#L96, we see that the default behavior is to use the underlying node's blend func. 

This can cause visual difference between cocos2d-js and cocos2d-x on native. It seems to me that native should match web's functionality, and if we hit the default case, we use the node's current blend func. 

Since SkeletonRenderer is under the spine licence, I wanted to bring this issue to the cocos2d-x team and get their blessing before I submit a PR to spine.

data.title: fix missing chinese characters when using ttf label
data.body: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16784

data.title: Missing Chinese characters when use GB2312 encoding TTF file
data.body:
When using Chinese TTF to rendering text, if the text contains some special Chinese characters which aren't inside the collection of GB2312, the entire sentence will be truncated when translated from UTF16 to GB2312.

This behavior only happen in Linux, iOS and MaxOS X. Because these platform use iconv to do the converting.

data.title: Support compile & run project on Tizen  by cocos command.

2. Update the submodule cocos2d-console for support compile & run project on Tizen.

EditBox doesn't show text when editing in Mac version (but no problem in iOS)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13 , 3.13.1
- devices test on: MacBook Pro 13 inch 2010 and iMac 27 inch 2010 (Mac OS Sierra)
    (Note: this issue doesn't appear before the Mac OS Sierra I upgraded from former os, and the issue appears after I completely reinstall Mac OS Sierra)
- developing environments
    Mac (but not ios) in Mac OS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:
1 .  create a EditBox

    bool HelloWorld::init(){
    EditBox* gameIdEditBox=EditBox::create(Size(480,180),Scale9Sprite::create());
    this->addChild(gameIdEditBox);
    gameIdEditBox->setInputMode(ui::EditBox::InputMode::SINGLE_LINE);
    gameIdEditBox->setReturnType(ui::EditBox::KeyboardReturnType::SEND);
    gameIdEditBox->setAnchorPoint(Vec2::ZERO);
    gameIdEditBox->setText("abc");
    return true;
    }

![e01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11567495/19843023/a7fa6c24-9f59-11e6-93f5-0ab3817ba562.png)

it can show the text when it is not editing

2 . when click the edit box and start to edit, the EditBox doesn't show the editing text:

![e02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11567495/19843059/e5a1c586-9f59-11e6-801c-65e65902e359.png)

3 . when edit finished, the text appear again, and it seems the text can change normally:

![e03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11567495/19843076/0ab73f40-9f5a-11e6-9bc1-e738358de392.png)

Note 1: I tried to solve the problem by setNeedsLayer in CCApplication-mac.mm

    int Application::run()
    {
        initGLContextAttrs();
        if(!applicationDidFinishLaunching())
        {
            return 1;
        }
    
        long lastTime = 0L;
        long curTime = 0L;
    
        auto director = Director::getInstance();
        auto glview = director->getOpenGLView();
        NSWindow* window = glview->getCocoaWindow();
        [[window contentView] setWantsLayer:YES];
        .
        .
        .

This time the EditBox can show normally but it contains a lot of OpenGL errors:

Before Editing:
![e04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11567495/19843169/c4631ef0-9f5a-11e6-95ae-d3d2ad449d80.png)

During Editing:
![e05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11567495/19843178/cb4d772e-9f5a-11e6-8088-b86c70471a18.png)

,and error logs after adding

        NSWindow* window = glview->getCocoaWindow();
        [[window contentView] setWantsLayer:YES];

in CCApplication-mac.mm:

2016-10-31 10:43:58.347564 TestEditBox-desktop[861:159412] [General] ERROR: Setting <GLFWContentView: 0x608000140160> as the first responder for window <GLFWWindow: 0x6000001e0200>, but it is in a different window ((null))! This would eventually crash when the view is freed. The first responder will be set to nil.
(

	7   TestEditBox-desktop                 0x00000001005fe272 _ZN7cocos2d10GLViewImpl14createWithRectERKNSt3__112basic_stringIcNS1_11char_traitsIcEENS1_9allocatorIcEEEENS_4RectEfb + 258

data.title: Misc. UIEditBoxImpl-winrt fixes
data.body:
- SENSITIVE doesn't imply password, fixes crash on static cast in onTextChanged (https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/ui/UIEditBox/UIEditBoxImpl-winrt.cpp#L126)
- Fix type fontName instead of pFontName
- Set attributes that affect text content before setting initial text
